title: How to Keep a Gas Stove Clean

steps.headline: Allow your stove to cool.
steps.description: Turn off all your gas burners and allow the stove to cool down completely before cleaning. Cleaning a stove while it is hot can result in injury.

steps.headline: Remove the burner grates and caps.
steps.description: Once the burners are cool, lift them away from the stove. Place them in the sink. Burners can be placed in a large bucket or wash basin if a sink is not available.

steps.headline: Fill the sink with hot water and dish soap.
steps.description: Completely submerge the burners in hot water. Add a drizzle of dish soap to the water while it is running to create suds. Allow the burners to soak while you clean the stove.

steps.headline: Brush away loose debris.
steps.description: With a cleaning brush or paper towel, brush away any loose debris. Don’t worry too much about scraping caked on food and grime.

steps.headline: Scrub the stovetop.
steps.description: Clean the top of the stove using a stovetop cleaner or soapy water. With a clean rag or sponge, scrub the surface. Pay close attention to caked on food and grime. Don’t forget to scrub the knobs and face. Spray some cleaner on tough spots and let it soak for five minutes before scrubbing. This will help to loosen the grime.

steps.headline: Clean around the burners.
steps.description: Use a toothbrush to get into the crooks where the burners and caps sit. These areas can be tough to reach with a rag. Then wipe the area clean with a rag.

steps.headline: Dry the stove.
steps.description: Use a clean cloth or paper towel to dry the stove’s surface. Drying the stove’s surface will prevent streaking and make your stove’s surface shine.

steps.headline: Scrub the burner grates.
steps.description: Using a toothbrush or sponge, wash the burner grates that were soaking in the sink. Most of the grime will wipe away fairly easy since they have been soaking for several minutes. Set the clean burners off to the side.

steps.headline: Scrub the burner caps.
steps.description: Using the same toothbrush or sponge, wash the burner caps. Set them off to the side with the burners.

steps.headline: Rinse the burner parts.
steps.description: With fresh, warm water, thoroughly rinse the burner grates and caps. Be sure rinse away all of the soapy residue. If the burners still aren’t clean after using dish soap, try a heavy-duty degreaser instead.

steps.headline: Dry the burner parts.
steps.description: Set the burner grates and caps on a mat to air dry. If you want the pieces to dry quickly, wipe them dry with a clean cloth or paper towel.

steps.headline: Secure the burner parts back on the stove.
steps.description: Once the parts are completely dry, place them back on the stovetop in their proper positions. Your stove is now ready for use once again.
